titleStmt.title: Truth flatters not plaine dealing the best. Lively demonstrating the true effigies, life, and habite, of a selfe-exalting clergie; noted down in English and Roman characters, easily spelled and construed by a meane capacity.
titleStmt.author: T. P.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: By T.P. a well-willer of verity, and honourer of humility.
The engraving is of four figures: Vertue, Priste, Prelate, and Herisie. The dialogues are by Pope, Prelate, Priest, and Truth.
Verse - "Who will have honours, and renown".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
